column4: my X session keeps hanging and I am having serious trouble debugging it. Am I likely to have more success with the prop drivers for my ATI card??
yes probably. did you look in ~/.xsession-errors?
ahah.. interesting.
try creating a new user and see if it happens when logged in as that user..
I'll give it a go
maybe some panel preference you set has gone awry somehow. does sound very unusual though.
this is a fresh install...
oh.. odd.
I have been trying to get ubuntu running on this machine for weeks now
odd. what's the machine?
AMD Athlon
dapper wouldnt install from cd for me - now would Edgy. tried all 64 and 32 bit versions only thing that would install was breezy 64bit

oh.. well i haven't had problems on this arch. perhaps you might want to install the proprietary graphics drivers. before you do though, install openssh-server and i can walk you through connecting to it from another machine.
do you have another UNIX machine around?
I have a dapper machine that never gave me problems  but it's a bit slow
but I only have one network uplink
probably hard disk speed related. install openssh-server on the offending machine, note the IP and ssh into it when it hangs. we can find out what's wrong.
ok.. can you get into a console though? eg with CTRL-ALT-F2
I tried the consoles - but when the X hangs so does the whole system
I know its a graphical problem because the machine doesnt hang if I leave the X alone and just go console based
was it you I was talking to about my broken X server???
yes you were talking to me about it
